content: queen anne s lace headband stitches chain = chain st = stitch single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch queen anne s lace is a pretty common crochet lace stitch pattern it s probably one of the first that comes up when searching crochet lace stitches on the internet you can find it in most crochet books and on most crochet sites you ll probably see it mostly in scarves but i think it s a nice stitch for a variety of project hems bracelets bookmarks headbands for my headband here i used some leftover 4 ply cotton yarn and a no 3 crochet the lace part is approximately 30 cm long and 5 5 cm wide and the cords are about 23 cm long first motif chain 6 and close the circle by slip_stitch in the first st chain 3 and make 13 double_crochet in the circle you should have 14 double_crochet counting the chain 3 as the first double_crochet chain 1 and turn make 1 single_crochet in each of the first 2 st * chain 4 1 st in each of the next 2 st* repreat *…* until the end of the row making sure to end in 2 single_crochet you should have 6 loops second motif chain 6 and turn slip_stitch in the first 4 chain loop of the first motif chain 3 and turn make 13 double_crochet in the loop you should have 14 double_crochet counting the chain 3 as the first slip_stitch in the first single_crochet of the first motif chain 1 and turn make 1 single_crochet in each of the first 2 st * chain 4 1 single_crochet in each of the next 2 st* repeat *…* until the end of the row ending in 2 single_crochet you should have 6 loops third motif chain 6 and turn slip_stitch in the first 4 chain loop of the second motif chain 3 and turn make 13 double_crochet in the loop you should have 14 double_crochet counting the chain 3 as the first slip_stitch in the nearest loop of the previous second motif chain 1 and turn make 1 single_crochet in the first st * chain 4 make 1 st in each of the next 2 st* repeat *…* until the end of the row ending in 2 single_crochet you should have 6 loops make 16 motifs or the number required to reach your desired length ending with a right side motif then make a half motif and end with a cord half motif chain 3 and turn slip_stitch in the first 4 chain loop of the previous motif chain 3 and turn make 6 double_crochet in the loop you should have 7 double_crochet counting the chain 3 as the first slip_stitch in the second loop of the previous motif chain 1 and turn make 1 single_crochet in the first st * chain 4 make 1 single_crochet in each of the next 2 st* repeat *…* until the end of the row ending in
